Both air temperature and humidity together contribute to the change in heat stress. Figure 2a–l shows the variations of the maximum atmospheric temperature (annual maxima of the daily maximum temperature, TXx, Figure 2 left column) and humidity (annual mean of the daily humidity, Figure 2 right column). The region with the largest temperature increase also often exhibited the greatest change in humidity, thus affecting the prediction of the wet-bulb temperature. Compared to the TXx change, the change in the wet-bulb temperature was slightly less ( Figure 3).
